references.paper_title: Zero-1-to-3: Zero-shot one image to 3d object
references.reason: This paper introduces Zero-1-to-3, a foundational model for single-object novel view synthesis that serves as the primary inspiration and baseline for the present work on multi-object novel view synthesis.
This work introduces denoising diffusion probabilistic models, the core generative model underlying the approach in the present work.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper presents Stable Diffusion, the specific diffusion model architecture employed in the present work.

references.paper_title: ZeroNVS: Zero-shot 360-degree view synthesis from a single real image
references.reason: This paper introduces ZeroNVS, a recent work on scene-level novel view synthesis that serves as one of the baselines for comparison in the present work.
This work presents the Segment Anything Model (SAM), used in the current work for object segmentation, enabling the incorporation of structural information for improved novel view synthesis.
